title: Former U.K. Prime Minister Boris Johnson quits Parliament after probe into 'partygate' statements
description: LONDON — Former U.K. Prime Minister Boris Johnson shocked Britain on Friday by quitting as a lawmaker after being told he will be sanctioned for misleading Parliament.

title: Blue Jays cut pitcher Anthony Bass after latest anti-LGBTQ comments
description: The Toronto Blue Jays cut pitcher Anthony Bass on Friday, one day after the right-handed reliever said he didn’t think an anti-LGBTQ social media post he shared last month was hateful.

title: Colombia and its largest remaining rebel group agree to a cease-fire at talks in Cuba
description: Colombia’s government and the country’s largest remaining guerrilla group, ELN, declared a cease-fire agreement Friday at talks in Cuba.

title: Italy’s Berlusconi in hospital for leukaemia scheduled checks
description: Former Italian Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi was re-admitted to hospital in Milan for a scheduled medical checkup on Friday, just weeks after being discharged following a long stay.

title: Joran van der Sloot, key suspect in Natalee Holloway’s disappearance, pleads not guilty to extortion charges
description: Joran van der Sloot, the chief suspect in the 2005 disappearance of Natalee Holloway, pleaded not guilty on Friday to charges that he attempted to extort money from the missing teen’s mother.

title: Seismic activity adds to evidence that explosion caused Ukraine dam collapse
description: Evidence was mounting Friday to support the theory that the destruction of the Kakhovka dam — the cause of one of the biggest humanitarian and ecological crises since the start of Russia's 15-month invasion of Ukraine — was caused by explosive devices.

title: Ukraine sends Western tanks into battle for the first time to bolster counteroffensive
description: Ukraine appears to have deployed Western  Leopard 2 battle tanks into combat for the first time, as Kyiv launches its counteroffensive against Russian forces in the southern Zaporizhzhia region.

title: Russia to deploy tactical nuclear weapons in Belarus in July, Putin says
description: Russia will start deploying tactical nuclear weapons in Belarus after special storage facilities are ready on July 7-8, President Vladimir Putin said on Friday, Moscow’s first move of such bombs outside Russia since the fall of the Soviet Union.

title: Locals in shock after stabbing attack on children in French town
description: Emotions ran high at the makeshift memorial in a children's playground where four toddlers were injured in a knife attack in the French Alps. All four children underwent surgery and are in critical but stable condition while two adults were injured in the attack suffered less serious injuries.

title: Man mauled to death by tiger shark off Egypt’s Red Sea coast
description: A Russian man died after being mauled by a shark on Thursday off one of Egypt’s Red Sea resorts, Egyptian and Russian authorities said.

title: Ukraine launches its long-awaited counteroffensive against Russian forces
description: NBC News has learned that Ukraine’s military has begun their long-anticipated counteroffensive against Russian forces. NBC News’ Raf Sanchez reports from Zaporizhzhia, Ukraine.

title: Child victims of France stabbing attack in critical but stable condition
description: France’s president traveled Friday to the side of families traumatized by the savage stabbings of four very young children, all said to be in stable condition after emergency surgery, while investigators worked to unravel the motives of a Syrian man taken into custody.

title: Mines, disease and more: The dangers lurking in Ukraine's floodwaters
description: Land mines displaced by flooding in the wake of the Kakhovka Dam collapse could pose a deadly threat to thousands of people as they evacuate in southern Ukraine.

title: Demining teams struggle to access Ukraine’s flooded minefields after dam explosion
description: Mines uprooted and dispersed by floodwaters surging downstream from the destroyed Kakhovka dam across swathes of southern Ukraine could pose a grave danger to civilians for decades to come, according to experts. The Hazardous Area Life-support Organization, known as HALO, which clears landmines in war zones, said it could not access minefields as roads leading to them are flooded.

title: Thousands evacuated in China’s Tianjin after cracks appear near high-rises
description: Thousands of people were evacuated from several high-rise apartment buildings in Tianjin, China, after land collapses created large cracks on nearby streets.

title: Golf's PGA Tour and LIV merger is the latest power play by Saudi Arabia
description: Observers say it's the latest attempt by the Saudis to flex their influence across a breadth of American institutions, from Hollywood to Silicon Valley.
